document.docAuthor: Barahona-Segovia, Rodrigo M., Riera, Pamela, Pañinao-Monsálvez, Laura, Guzmán, Vicente Valdés & Henríquez-Piskulich, Patricia
document.masterDocTitle: Updating the knowledge of the flower flies (Diptera: Syrphidae) from Chile: Illustrated catalog, extinction risk and biological notes

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Updating the knowledge of the flower flies (Diptera: Syrphidae) from Chile: Illustrated catalog, extinction risk and biological notes

figureCitation.captionText: FIGURES 4–9. Myolepta haemorrhoidalis (Philippi, 1865): (4) female visiting flowers of Crataegus sp., Cerro Isla Carlos Condell, Curicó (photo by Joaquín Sepulveda) and (5) dorsal view (photo by Patricia Henríquez). Scale bar = 1 mm. Myolepta luctuosus (Bigot, 1857): (6) female visiting Trevoa quinquenervia, Gillies & Hook, Rio Clarillo National Park (photo by Daniel Llavaneras) and (7) dorsal view (photo by Patricia Henríquez). Scale bar = 1 mm. Myolepta nausicaa (Hull, 1937): (8) dorsal view (photo by Kevin Moran, CNC) and (9) lateral view (photo by Kevin Moran, CNC). Scale bars = 2 mm.

Priomerus haemorrhoidalis
Philippi, 1865: 740
Type locality and data. “ Santiago , Chile ” (T, A, MNHNCL).

Chilean distribution. From Coquimbo to La Araucanía region ( Fig. 10 ).
Altitudinal range. From coastal to precordillera ecosystems (50– 1,000 m .a.s.l.).

Biology and notes.
Myolepta haemorrhoidalis
is a species associated to exotic flora as
Crataegus
sp. (Joaquín Sepúlveda, CSP record; Fig. 4 ) and
Prunus domestica
L. (Orlando Montes, CSP record) and native tree
Quillaja saponaria Molina
( Victoria Kunst, CSP record).
Conservation status. LC; EOO = 25,360 km 2 ; AOO = 68 km 2 ; 15 localities and subpopulations.
